title: How should I study for gaining above 95% on the board of class 10? - Quora
tags: Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: Thanks for asking the question… I think I m eligible to answer this. I scored 95.6% in CBSE Class X 2017–18. Now With very minimal amount to study, it depends on your previous preparations too, that how much you are familiar with your concepts of textbooks.Now I am assuming that you are through with your whole syllabus of all subjects at least once, then you need to focus on good revision and to check not even a single word and a single question is missed from all your NCERT books. Each and every question should be practiced and especially for science you need to focus on each and every line. A subject-wise plan for you assuming you are having subjects English, 2nd language subject, Maths, Science and Social Science 1.English Read each and every literature chapter with full focus on important lines because there is the base of extract-based questions. Practice the questions of writing section at least 3 questions per type and the most scoring part is the reading section doesn’t need any more practice.Now if you have completed this, purchase or get a book of sample papers and solve it properly and practice the time management and the reading comprehension.Now marks in this subject depend on your vocabulary too … 2. 2nd LanguageStudy thoroughly from your textbook prescribed. I don't think it is difficult to score in this part. Rest it also depends on your practice and retaining power 3. MathsThe most important subject and my favorite subject of all time.As always NCERT questions must be on your tips. Get the previous year's question paper and solve it like a real test. I also got to know from this year there are two levels of mathematics paper - standard and basic with the varying difficulty levels. Get a book like U-like or Xam idea and start solving. If you like maths then it will be a fun task to prepare for this exam. Learn all the formulas properly and start tackling the nervousness because “Tu Phod Kar Aaega” *Translation - You Will crack the exam* 4. ScienceNCERT is the bible for this subject, it must have occupied your heart till now.Practice the most important questions because science paper has a lot of repeating questions. Solve your pre-board papers and the again get a book like Xam idea, I 'll prefer this because it has chapter wise questions too and start solving it and solve 5–6 sample papers you are good to go. 5. Social ScienceA horrific subject for me but scored 97 in it. Honestly, I didn’t touch NCERT but I ll recommend you do this. I prepared for this subject from Arihant All in One which was a complete study package and it was my soul helper in the subject. Focus more on answer presentation like write 5–6 points apt to questions in 5 marks questions and 3–4 points in 3 marks question. It also depends on your ability to retain the facts and dates, interpretation of concepts learned from the book which requires higher-order thinking.Practice the sample paper for this too. It will help you a lot. Also, don’t forget to download the official CBSE sample papers and solve it properly. Choose a time to study which suits you the best. I use to study from 11:00 PM to 5:00 AM as it is the time with maximum peace but don’t copy this as it can vary from person to person, depends on your biological clock. You are getting good 5–6 days for preparing each subject, so if you are dedicated enough then you can follow the tips above. Practice more and more and extract time to chill out too as 10th exams are the easiest exams. Good Luck For Your Exams.. #tuphodega Please Upvote my 3rd answer, it will really motivate me Thanks …..

Dear friend, First of all think about getting 100% ,then you will achieve 95% . Now I would like to share some tips that can help you to achieve desired percentage. Let's talk about real situation Total month= 10 ,when you pass the exam of 9 th class and enter 10 standard ,now total available time for study approx 10 month. I think total subjects 8. Major subject 3 that is ..P,C,M,B Rest non technical.. English हिंदी ,SST etc 8 subjects ,more or less ,and total 10 months. You have to plan accordingly ,,attending school ,attending coaching ,etc Home study management all. You have to keep one month for mock test ,revision ,previous year paper solutions etc. Try to make a schedule first start ..Core subject's…because the revision of core subject will take time. You have to study as per school syllabus ,with revision , Focus on most scoring subjects ,like Physics ,chemistry ,maths ,all solid marks subjectv. You can change your preference accordingly.. Every month during weekend you have to study non tech subject like ..English ..Hindi..SST. Every month..Saturday Sunday…you have to give time for English ..Hindi..Other subjects…so 8 days .. When 6 months completed…then start non tech subjects…5 days week…rest 2 days….choose physics…chemistry..Maths… This is the way…you have to study n plan.. Use hand written formulas. Try to solve examples. Try to study continuous means every day study. Try to prepare a time table. Revision schedule. After school and coaching you will get only 4–5 hours you have to study revised per day…for getting 95 % … You have to focused.. Don't use social media…Fb…instagram..Yes QUORA..Also.. “ बहुत सारी चीज़ें बंद करनी पड़ेगी आपको ” ..समय आप के पास बहुत ज्यादा नही है लेकिन हां ठीक तरीके से मेहनत करोगी तो 95 ,% आ जाएगा। I just want to suggest ,what ever you will study ,it should be solid and memorable for long time.. 95% बोर्ड में पाने के बाद असली एग्जाम शुरू होगा। कॉलेज में एंट्रेंस एग्जाम का। Well ,think about first how you have to prepare… If face any problem ,feel free to drop comments.
